protein.specific_function: Poly(ADP-ribose) synthesized after DNA damage is only present transiently and is rapidly degraded by poly(ADP-ribose) glycohydrolase. Poly(ADP-ribose) metabolism may be required for maintenance of the normal function of neuronal cells. Generates ADP-ribose from poly-(ADP-ribose), but does not hydrolyze ADP- ribose-arginine, -cysteine, -diphthamide, or -asparagine bonds

reference.reference_text: Glowacki G, Braren R, Firner K, Nissen M, Kuhl M, Reche P, Bazan F, Cetkovic-Cvrlje M, Leiter E, Haag F, Koch-Nolte F: The family of toxin-related ecto-ADP-ribosyltransferases in humans and the mouse. Protein Sci. 2002 Jul;11(7):1657-70.
